TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in GPE . They are represented before the ORG by Mr Christian Holmsten , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties and as they appear from the documents , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE and DATE , a forest in GPE in the municipality of PERSON , owned by PERSON , a relative of the applicants , was sold to a company PERSON Ab for FIM CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) and PERSON ( ORG CARDINAL ) respectively .
On DATE , PERSON died . The applicants became beneficiaries of his estate .

On DATE the applicants filed a criminal complaint with the police in GPE , GPE ( which later became PERSON police ) against NORP , S. ’s brother . They alleged that the sales of DATE and DATE were not executed by PERSON , but by O. for his own or his son R. ’s benefit . They submitted various documents to support their allegations .

On DATE CARDINAL witness was questioned . On DATE the police interrogated O. , who told the police that the proceeds of the sales of the forest were paid to his son NORP According to the pre - trial investigation report the police questioned the applicants on DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE . In these interviews the applicants stated that they sought damages from NORP and/or NORP
On DATE the police interrogated NORP , who lived in GPE , by telephone . NORP was never heard in person by the police .

On DATE the police concluded their investigations . On DATE the public prosecutor lodged charges against O. and NORP before ORG ( käräjäoikeus , tingsrätten ) of PERSON . On DATE the court held a hearing . On DATE ORG convicted PERSON and NORP , who had denied the charges , of aggravated theft and aggravated receiving of stolen goods respectively , and sentenced them to CARDINAL months’ and CARDINAL months’ conditional imprisonment respectively . The court ordered them jointly to pay damages to the applicants .

O. and NORP appealed to ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ) of GPE . On DATE it held an oral hearing . On DATE the court reversed the judgment of ORG , acquitting ORG and NORP and quashing the decision on damages . The appellate court excluded the pre - trial statement by NORP as it had not been obtained from him in person but by telephone . Furthermore , it found that there was not enough evidence of any criminal conduct concerning the forest sale of DATE . As to the sale of DATE , the court found that it was unclear who had signed the contract .

On DATE the applicants applied for leave to appeal from ORG , claiming , inter alia , that ORG should have referred the case to ORG for reconsideration . When the court excluded ORG pre - trial statement as evidence , NORP was allegedly able to tailor his statements before the domestic courts to fit the statements of the complainants and witnesses . They further claimed that the pre - trial investigation , which had lasted CARDINAL years , had not been carried out properly .
On DATE ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) refused leave to appeal .

Section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL of LAW ( esitutkintalaki , förundersökningslag ; Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) provides that the police or another investigation authority shall carry out a pre - trial investigation when , on the basis of a report made to it or otherwise , there is reason to believe that an offence has been committed .

According to section CARDINAL of the said LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) the civil - party claim of the injured party has to be clarified in the pre - trial investigation , if the injured party has requested the public prosecutor to pursue his / her claim at the trial .
Section CARDINAL of the said LAW provides that a pre - trial investigation shall be carried out without undue delay .

Section CARDINAL of the said LAW ( as in force at the relevant time ) provided that a person to be interrogated had to be present in person . However , in cases of minor significance , a suspect could give his / her statement through an attorney or by telephone , provided that he / she did not deny the alleged offence .

Under LAW , LAW CARDINAL of LAW ( laki oikeudenkäynnistä rikosasioissa , lag om rättegång i brottmål ; Act no.CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) a civil claim arising from the offence for which a charge has been brought , may be heard in connection with the charge . If such a claim is lodged separately , the provisions on civil procedure apply .

Section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL of the said LAW provides that on the request of the injured party , the public prosecutor shall pursue the civil claim of the injured party , arising from the offence for which the charge has been brought if this is possible without major inconvenience and if the claim is not manifestly ill - founded . Under subsection CARDINAL the injured party shall lodge his / her request during the pre - trial investigation or with the prosecutor . He / she shall also provide an account of the circumstances on which the claim is founded .

Section CARDINAL of the LAW of Finland ( perustuslaki , grundlagen ; Act no . GPE ) provides that everyone has the right to have his or her case dealt with appropriately and without undue delay by a legally competent court of law or other authority . This section is equivalent to LAW of LAW of DATE ( PERSON , ORG ) , as in force at the relevant time .
